items.title: LoI signed to establish Centre of Excellence for CRISPR Innovation and Translation (CoE-CIT)
items.summary:
- LoI signed to establish the Centre of Excellence for CRISPR Innovation and Translation (CoE-CIT) to translate CRISPR from bench to bedside.
- A public–private collaboration between JNCASR (Bengaluru) and CrisprBits (Delhi) to leverage fundamental science with translational platforms including affordable diagnostics.
- CoE-CIT is designed as a replicable national model to strengthen academia–industry collaboration and India's biotechnology ecosystem.

items.title: New study may redefine how the mass of the halo around galaxies is measured
items.summary:
- Researchers show CGM ionized oxygen measurements can be contaminated by IGM gas, biasing halo mass estimates.
- Their CGM+IGM model suggests IGM contributes most O VI: for MW-like galaxies CGM ~50%, low-mass ~30%.
- This could explain discrepancies in CGM masses; updates to models are needed to include IGM effects for accurate galaxy evolution inferences (ApJ).

items.title: Scientists reveal the importance of sponge-associated microbes in tackling metal pollution
items.summary: - Freshwater sponges from the Sundarban delta host diverse microbial communities and can act as bioindicators of toxic metal pollution and as natural sorbents for arsenic, lead, and cadmium. - Sponge-associated bacteria differ from surrounding water and are enriched in genes related to metal ion transport, metal resistance, and antimicrobial resistance, indicating active detoxification and environmental stress resilience. - This is the first report of bacterial diversity among Sundarban freshwater sponges and supports sustainable water-quality management and bioremediation strategies, with DST SERB National Post-Doctoral Fellowship support.

items.title: Newly uncovered missing link in cellular cleanup can help develop therapeutic strategies for Alzheimer's, Parkinson's, and Cancer
items.summary:
- The exocyst complex is identified as a key regulator of autophagy, particularly in early autophagosome biogenesis.
- Seven of eight exocyst components are required for proper autophagosome formation; loss disrupts autophagy and yields defective autophagosomes; yeast models reveal how secretion machinery links to autophagy.
- Autophagy defects are linked to neurodegenerative diseases (e.g., Alzheimer's, Huntington's) and cancer; therapeutically modulating autophagy may restore cellular balance.

items.title: New MoU can help Commercialisation of Sodium-Ion Battery Technology
items.summary:
- ARCI and Voltasun signed an MoU (15 Dec 2025) to validate and potentially commercialise Na-ion pouch cells using ARCI's NVP cathode.
- Phase I: 80 pouch cells for performance validation; Phase II envisages two more 80-cell sets to scale toward industry deployment.
- Aimed at moving from lab-scale to industry-ready deployment for India's energy storage self-reliance, with Voltasun evaluating performance and expanding stationary-storage applications.

items.title: Peptide therapy emerges as a game-changer for eye infections
items.summary:
- Researchers from LV Prasad Eye Institute and Bose Institute report SA-XV, a 15-residue peptide from S100A12, inhibiting Fusarium and Candida (biofilms) and reducing keratitis in mouse models; SA-XV is non-toxic and serum-stable.
- Mechanism: binds fungal cell wall/membrane, translocates to cytoplasm, accumulates in the nucleus to bind DNA and halt the cell cycle, then targets mitochondria to permeabilize them and induce apoptosis, with potential wound-healing effects.
- Published in Journal of Biological Chemistry (doi:10.1016/j.jbc.2025.110743); suggests a dual antifungal and wound-healing approach for fungal keratitis.

items.title: New sunlight-driven method to break tough C-F bonds useful for pharmaceutical and agrochemical industries
items.summary:
- Sunlight-driven, heterogeneous photocatalysis cleaves strong C-F bonds in fluoroarenes using covalent organic frameworks.
- Post-synthetic methylation yields Tp-Bpy-Me COF, increasing electron deficiency and visible-light absorption to enable C–F activation and C–N coupling under blue light.
- Greener, recyclable COF photocatalyst allows C-F to C-N conversion under mild conditions with potential for pharmaceutical and agrochemical synthesis.

items.title: New path found for a better & comprehensive therapy for Alzheimer's disease
items.summary:
- EDTNPs combine EGCG, dopamine, and tryptophan into multifunctional nanoparticles to target Aβ aggregation, oxidative stress, neuroinflammation, and neuronal loss.
- Incorporating BDNF yields B-EDTNPs with enhanced neuroprotection, showing favorable in vitro and mouse-model results.
- The approach could slow progression, improve cognition, and enable more personalized AD therapy; reported in Small.

items.title: DST hosts foreign media delegation, familiarises them with India's Science & Technology Advancements
items.summary:
- DST hosted an interactive session with 40+ foreign media journalists during the 9–18 Dec 2025 visit, organized by the MEA.
- Secretary Abhay Karandikar outlined India's evolving S&T ecosystem, national missions, and the Vision for Viksit Bharat @2047, underscoring a whole-of-government engine for innovation-led growth.
- The discussion covered AI, cybersecurity, repatriation of researchers, and expanding global collaborations to position India as a future-ready innovation leader for informed reporting.

items.title: Secrets of influence of Himalayan air movements on monsoons can improve predictions
items.summary:
- ARIES and ISRO SPL used the Stratosphere–Troposphere radar to measure vertical air motion over central Himalayas during ASMA, achieving 5 cm s-1 resolution.
- Identified a persistent downward layer around 10–11 km, showing a more complex ASMA circulation with alternating rising and sinking regions.
- Suggests a two-step transport from lower troposphere to the stratosphere, enabling potential improvements in monsoon predictions and climate models.

items.title: New light to track gene editing
items.summary:
- GlowCas9 is a bioluminescent, thermostable Cas9 variant enabling real-time visualization of CRISPR edits in living cells, tissues, and plant leaves.
- It fuses Cas9 with split nano-luciferase fragments that emit light only when Cas9 folds correctly, enabling noninvasive monitoring and improving HDR precision.
- The platform supports theratracking and safe, nontransgenic monitoring in crops; led by Dr Basudeb Maji and Arkadeep Karmakar, published in Angew. Chem. Int. Ed. 2025.
